# isCancelled

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value that indicates whether the receiver is cancelled.

## Declaration

```swift
var isCancelled: Bool { get }
```

## Discussion

[doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] if the receiver has been cancelled, otherwise [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

If your thread supports cancellation, it should check this property periodically and exit if it ever returns [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true].

## Related Documentation

- **cancel()**: Changes the cancelled state of the receiver to indicate that it should exit.

## Determining the Thread’s Execution State

- **isExecuting**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the receiver is executing.
- **isFinished**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the receiver has finished execution.
